results.content: Toshendra is ESL and he tends to speak rapidly.  For a beginner, that makes him hard to keep up with, but the transcript feature makes it easy to catch up.  He uses a lot of XML that I am not expecting to use in my position but was fascinating to watch in case I need it as I advance.

results.content: It was very precise and on to the point, the more you listn the more you get,Thanks Toshendra Sharma ji.

results.content:
I enjoyed this course a lot, and it provided a great overview of XML as well as practice tying and debugging the code.  Sometimes I had a problem with the accent, but that was rare and not at all a show stopper.  

I'm going to continue in my quest to really learn all the parts of XML.  If you know HTML, you shouldn't have a problem with this course.
results.content_html:
I enjoyed this course a lot, and it provided a great overview of XML as well as practice tying and debugging the code. Sometimes I had a problem with the accent, but that was rare and not at all a show stopper.

I'm going to continue in my quest to really learn all the parts of XML. If you know HTML, you shouldn't have a problem with this course.

results.content: While this was a fairly basic overview, it left out many large chunks necessary to understanding and executing the topic. For example, no guidance was given as regards an XML editor to use, nor was there any guidance on how to do certain things without a plugin to a given editor (namely tabulation and correct alignment...I'm still not sure if this is a necessary part of an XML document or not). Similarly, it was not at all clear whether certain elements were mandatory in order to make the XML document function or whether they are malleable and changeable depending on the needs of the user. Furthermore, while it is possible to recreate the documents shown in the slideshows, no practical exercises were set up in any way. So while this was fairly informative, it is nothing I couldn't recreate from a much shorter time spent googling and reading an article or two...I'm not sure why I should have paid for this.
